div.p: My job does impact on my life outside work because unfortunately it’s time constraint, you know you can suddenly say at 5 o’clock you can go home
so I may have made arrangements to see the kids and unfortunately you’ve sometimes got to pick up the phone and say “I’m sorry I can’t make it
because such and such a thing has happened” but it’s got better, I will say that, 13 years ago you couldn’t really plan anything but now
we’ve got to the stage where we’ve got more staff in place and management in place to deal with things and I’m finding now
that my weekends are getting a lot more freer and it’s time to enjoy the rugby really so you know it really depends. And again it really depends
on the time of year as well, we’re coming into what I call “silly season” at the moment which is coming up to Christmas and that can
sort of really have an impact on time because customers want everything at the same time so that will definitely have an impact.
My health... I’m pretty healthy, I think I’ve been lucky really more than anything, I don’t think it’s really impacted on my work;
I walk quite a lot and there’s a lot of walking around in my sort of job really because as well as being joint MD I do go out and do surveys
quite a lot so I am on my feet walking around so it is quite an energetic type of work so you do really get exercise whilst you work I suppose in one way.
